data.text: 61 million people live with a disability in the United States. As affordable housing becomes an increasing challenge in communities nationally, disabled people are disparately impacted -- priced out from homes in their communities, facing inaccessible housing stock, and experiencing higher rates of homelessness and housing insecurity. This is a solvable problem. Join a panel of disabled leaders to explore what innovative solutions in design, development, public policy, and entrepreneurship can be deployed to create a fully inclusive, disability-forward housing future.
